text:
When using the OO open/save dialogs to open an .odt file, selecting the file and
then hitting open does not open the file but brings you back to the open dialog box.

However, this procedure works when opening .html files.
creator: jonathan.addison@wyona.com
jonathan.addison@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 17959
Removes sitemap references to .html extension and generalize for all file extensions

.odt (and other) files	are now matched in the webdav sitemap and open
correctly within OpenOffice when using the OO open/save dialogs.

The sitemap matchers for HEAD and DELETE requests were also generalized for all
file extensions.

The OO open/save dialogs do not allow browsing of Windows XP Network Places so
the url must be typed in.  http://localhost:{port-number}/default/webdav/ shows
the contents of the webdav folder, or using
http://localhost:{port-number}/default/webdav/doctypes/opendocument_en.odt
opens the file directly.
